'''Grotle''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ハヤシガメ''' ''Hayashigame'') is a {{type|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Turtwig}} starting at [[level]] 18 and evolves into {{p|Torterra}} starting at level 32.

==Biology==
[[File:Grotle acorn.png|thumb|left|220px|Grotle with acorns]]
Grotle is a quadruped Pokémon with light green skin and a large shell covering its back. The shell is composed of hardened soil and conforms to the shape of Grotle's body, extending from its forehead to the tip of its short tail. The shell appears sectioned and is yellow with three long, brown ridges atop it. There are two bush-like trees growing around the outermost ridges. Grotle's lower jaw is yellow and has triangular extensions on the cheeks, while its upper jaw has a hooked tip. Its feet are yellow and have three claws each.

Grotle has the ability to sense where pure water wells up, and will carry other Pokémon on its back to these sources. Grotle lives in forests, but leaves during the day to allow more sunlight on its trees. Berries grow on the trees, attracting some species of Pokémon. In the anime, Grotle is seen to produce acorn-like nuts instead.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Grotle.png|thumb|left|230px|Grotle in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Grotle]]====
{{Ash}}'s Turtwig evolved into Grotle in ''[[DP100|Aiding the Enemy!]]''. This marked Grotle's debut appearance in the anime. In ''[[DP166|The Fleeing Tower of Sunyshore!]]'', Grotle evolved into {{p|Torterra}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Grotle appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

===Pokédex entries===
{{Animedexheader|Sinnoh}}
{{Animedexbody|DP100|Grotle|Ash's Pokédex|Grotle, the Grove Pokémon and the evolved form of {{p|Turtwig}}. Grotle lives near water in forests, and leaves the forest during the {{DL|Time|day}} to {{m|Synthesis|allow light to shine}} on the tree on its shell.}}
{{Animedexfooter/Pokémon|''Diamond & Pearl''|Sinnoh}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Tru Grotle.png|thumb|125px|Grotle in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Tru}}
In ''[[PS346|Ring Around the Roserade I]]'', {{adv|Diamond}}'s Turtwig, Tru, evolved into a a Grotle. He became stronger and (slightly) faster in this new form, but was scarcely used for battles, as he would have been ineffective against [[Gardenia]]'s {{type|Grass}} Pokémon, though he still helped {{adv|Platinum}} train for future Gym battles. Soon afterwards, Grotle became a {{p|Torterra}} alongside [[Chimler]] in [[Veilstone City]] fighting a legion of {{tc|Galactic Grunt}}s, and his power and endurance grew tremendously.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
{{OBP|Jun|DPA}}'s Turtwig evolved into a Grotle off-screen and later into Torterra.

==Trivia==
* Grotle is the heaviest of the second-stage [[starter Pokémon]].
* Grotle is the only second-stage [[Sinnoh]] starter Pokémon to [[Evolution|evolve]] at [[level]] 32. {{p|Monferno}} and {{p|Prinplup}} both evolve at level 36.
* When Grotle evolves into {{p|Torterra}}, all of its stats increase by 20 points.

===Origin===
{{Bulbanews|On the Origin of Species: Turtwig, Grotle and Torterra}}
Grotle is based on a {{wp|Chelydridae|snapping turtle}}, but may also originate from a {{wp|World Turtle}}, most likely Akūpāra. The ''{{wp|Cultural depictions of turtles and tortoises#Japan|minogame}}'' could be another inspiration.

====Name origin====
Grotle is a combination of ''{{wp|grove (nature)|grove}}'' and ''{{wp|turtle}}''. It may also derive from ''{{wp|grotto}}'' or ''grow'', referring to its Grass type.

Hayashigame is a combination of 林 ''hayashi'' (grove) and 亀 ''kame'' (turtle).
